content: * round 2 knit all stitches repeat rounds 1 and 2 until 18 stitches remain changing to double point needles when necessary finishing cut yarn leaving a tail of at least 6 inches thread the tail onto a tapestry needle thread the tail through all of the remaining stitches and pull tightly together sew through again and thread the needle through to the inside weave the yarn tail through stitches on the back trimming the tail if necessary wet block the beret and place on a round form to dry a 10-1/2 11 diameter circle of cardboard may be useful to shape the beret to its classic form depending on the drape of your yarn this shape will be more or less distinct when the beret is dry additional pattern notes i wanted a more fulled or felted look without actually shrinking the fibers so i raised the nap of the yarn by gently brushing with a cat brush the kind that has small wires that are slightly bent at the end not too strong the idea is to add a slight soft halo to the yarn make sure to do this only when the hat is fully dry to avoid ripping the yarn or stitches decreases for the strawberry seahorse design if you d like a more dramatic design on the top of the beret with the decrease row do as follows row 1 *k1 ssk knit to 3 stitches before the marker k2 decrease k1 sm * repeat * to * around row 2 knit all stitches in the round after completing row 2 with 5 stitches between markers work as follows *k1 sl 1 k2tog psso k1 * repeat * to * around removing markers as you go finish as above please note this is an original design provided to you free of charge if you use it for commercial purposes or use it as part of a class please credit the designer
